questions.question: Choose the word that means "to write again":
questions.explanation: "Rewrite" means to write something again. The prefix "re-" means "again," so when we add it to "write," we get "rewrite," which means to write something one more time, often to improve it.

questions.question: Which word means "full of beauty"?
questions.explanation: "Beautiful" means full of beauty or very pretty. The suffix "-ful" means "full of," so when we add it to "beauty," we get "beautiful," which describes something that has a lot of beauty or is very pleasing to look at.

questions.question: What does "powerless" mean?
questions.explanation: "Powerless" means without power or unable to do anything. The suffix "-less" means "without," so when we add it to "power," we get "powerless," which describes a situation where someone doesn't have the ability or strength to change things.

questions.question: Which word means "to heat again"?
questions.explanation: "Reheat" means to heat something again. The prefix "re-" means "again," so when we add it to "heat," we get "reheat," which means to make something warm one more time, often with food that has already been cooked.

questions.question: Choose the correct spelling:
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is “A-U-S-T-R-A-L-I-A.” Australia is a country famous for its natural wonders, wide-open spaces, beaches, deserts, "The Bush," and "The Outback."

questions.question: What does "prepack" mean?
questions.explanation: "Prepack" means to pack something before it's needed or sold. The prefix "pre-" means "before," so "prepack" is when we prepare and package something ahead of time.

questions.question: Which word means "full of joy"?
questions.explanation: "Joyful" means full of joy or very happy. The suffix "-ful" means "full of," so when we add it to "joy," we get "joyful," which describes someone or something that has a lot of happiness or brings happiness to others.

questions.question: What does "careless" mean?
questions.explanation: "Careless" means without care or not being careful. The suffix "-less" means "without," so when we add it to "care," we get "careless," which describes someone who doesn't pay attention to details or doesn't try to avoid mistakes.

questions.question: Which word means "to arrange again"?
questions.explanation: "Rearrange" means to arrange something again or differently. The prefix "re-" means "again," so when we add it to "arrange," we get "rearrange," which means to change the order or position of things one more time.

questions.question: What does "preorder" mean?
questions.explanation: "Preorder" means to order something before it's available. The prefix "pre-" means "before," so "preorder" is when we ask for something to be reserved or purchased before it's officially released or in stock.

questions.question: Choose the word that means "to lead wrongly":
questions.explanation: "Mislead" means to lead someone in the wrong direction or give incorrect information. The prefix "mis-" means "wrongly" or "badly," so when we add it to "lead," it means to guide someone in a way that's not right or true.

questions.question: Which word means "full of wonder"?
questions.explanation: "Wonderful" means full of wonder or amazing. The suffix "-ful" means "full of," so when we add it to "wonder," we get "wonderful," which describes something that's great or causes a feeling of awe.

questions.question: What does "speechless" mean?
questions.explanation: "Speechless" means without speech or unable to speak, often because of surprise or strong emotion. The suffix "-less" means "without," so when we add it to "speech," we get "speechless," which describes someone who is so surprised that they can't find words to say.

questions.question: Which word means "to think before"?
questions.explanation: "Prethink" means to think about something before it happens. The prefix "pre-" means "before," so when we add it to "think," we get "prethink," which means to consider or plan something ahead of time.

questions.question: What does "sleepless" mean?
questions.explanation: "Sleepless" means without sleep or unable to sleep. The suffix "-less" means "without," so when we add it to "sleep," we get "sleepless," which describes someone who can't fall asleep or hasn't slept.

questions.question: Choose the word that means "to appear again":
questions.explanation: "Reappear" means to appear again or come back into view. The prefix "re-" means "again," so when we add it to "appear," we get "reappear," which means to show up or become visible one more time.

questions.question: Which word means "full of peace"?
questions.explanation: "Peaceful" means full of peace or very calm. The suffix "-ful" means "full of," so when we add it to "peace," we get "peaceful," which describes a situation or place that is quiet, calm, and without conflict.

questions.question: What does "mismatch" mean?
questions.explanation: "Mismatch" means to match things wrongly or put together things that don't go well together. The prefix "mis-" means "wrongly" or "badly," so when we add it to "match," it means to combine things that don't fit or belong together.

questions.question: Which word means "to load before"?
questions.explanation: "Preload" means to load something before it's needed. The prefix "pre-" means "before," so when we add it to "load," we get "preload," which means to put things in or on something ahead of time.

questions.question: What does "restless" mean?
questions.explanation: "Restless" means without rest or unable to relax or be still. The suffix "-less" means "without," so when we add it to "rest," we get "restless," which describes someone who can't sit still or feels anxious.
